definition: A memory encoding process that stores information as context-rich episodes tied to particular times, places, or situations.

positive_examples: I remember the evening we first deployed the new model, including the room, people, and emotions.
The system logged the full context of the incident, not just the error code.
She stored the conversation together with the timestamp and location.
negative_examples: He memorized the phone number without any story around it.
The system stored only aggregated statistics.
She learned the definition but not when she first encountered it.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not general memory storage; specifically encoding experiences as contextual episodes tied to a particular event.
